definition: to be used to the sight of
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
accustomed to/used to/indulge/to spoil (a child)

sentences.english: Used to seeing the kind of joys and sorrows, may suddenly feel this is the life.
sentences.chinese: 看惯了那种悲欢离合，突然觉得可能这才是生活。

sentences.english: The doctor who had been used to see separation and death burst into tears at that moment.
sentences.chinese: 看惯了生离死别的医生，却在这一刻落泪了。

sentences.english: Because of the advertising boom, people are used to seeing high standards of visual design.
sentences.chinese: 由于广告的热潮，人们看惯了高标准的视觉设计。

sentences.english: Things we see often, we will not be suspicious about.
sentences.chinese: 平常看惯的就不在怀疑。

definition: a common occurrence (idiom)
to be weary of/to be fed up with/tedious
ostentatious/pretentious/showy
thousand articles, same rule (idiom); stereotyped and repetitive/once you've seen one, you've seen them all
bored/to be fed up with/sick and tired of sth
to decorate/to adorn/to dress up/to disguise oneself
to exaggerate/to be boastful/pompous/grandiose
lanterns red, wine green (idiom); feasting and pleasure-seeking/debauched and corrupt environment
to have quite a lasting charm
(idiom) inharmonious/incompatible
former days/the past
the hypocrisy of the world (idiom)
dull/insipid
remarkably alike
not at all surprising (idiom)
red flowers and green willow/all the colors of spring
